title: 107_s2187
content: The Act titled "Department of Veterans Affairs Emergency Medical Care Act of 2002" authorizes the Department to provide health care during major disasters and medical emergencies. The Department of Veterans Affairs can provide hospital care and medical services during major disasters and emergencies as authorized by the "Department of Veterans Affairs Emergency Medical Care Act of 2002." The Secretary of the Department of Veterans Affairs can provide hospital care and medical services to individuals affected by disasters or emergencies declared by the President or when the National Disaster Medical System is activated. The Secretary of the Department of Veterans Affairs can provide care and services to veterans during major disasters or emergencies declared by the President or when the National Disaster Medical System is activated, regardless of their enrollment status. Priority may be given to veterans over other eligible groups for care and services. The Secretary of the Department of Veterans Affairs can prioritize care and services for veterans during emergencies, giving them higher priority over other eligible groups, except for veterans with service-connected disabilities and active duty members of the Armed Forces receiving health-care services. The Department of Veterans Affairs can prioritize care for veterans during emergencies, except for those with service-connected disabilities and active duty members receiving health-care services. Reimbursement for care provided to federal government employees is based on agreed rates. Amounts received by the Department under this arrangement are specified. The Department of Veterans Affairs can prioritize care for veterans during emergencies, except for those with service-connected disabilities and active duty members receiving health-care services. Reimbursement for care provided to federal government employees is based on agreed rates, with amounts received credited to the Department facility. In the event of a disaster or emergency, care and services are furnished by the Secretary within 60 days, or as soon as practicable. The Secretary of the Department of Veterans Affairs shall submit a report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding the allocation of facilities and personnel for providing care and services during disasters or emergencies. Regulations will be prescribed for governing the Secretary's authority under this section. The Secretary of the Department of Veterans Affairs will report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs about the allocation of facilities and personnel for providing care during disasters or emergencies. Regulations will be prescribed for governing the Secretary's authority under this section. During major disasters and medical emergencies, charges for emergency care may be waived, as specified in section 1711A of the title. Members of the Armed Forces are provided with care during periods of war or national emergencies involving armed conflict. During war or national emergencies involving armed conflict, the Secretary may provide hospital care, nursing home care, and medical services to active duty members of the Armed Forces. Additionally, during disasters or emergencies, hospital care and medical services can be furnished to active duty members responding to or involved in the situation. During disasters or emergencies, the Secretary may provide hospital care and medical services to active duty members of the Armed Forces responding to the situation. This includes major disasters declared by the President or when the National Disaster Medical System is activated. During disasters or emergencies, the Secretary may prioritize providing care and services to active duty members of the Armed Forces over other eligible groups, except for veterans with service-connected disabilities. The Secretary may prioritize care for active duty members during disasters, giving higher priority than other eligible groups, except veterans with service-connected disabilities. Definitions for 'hospital care', 'nursing home care', and 'medical services' are provided in this section.
